title: feat: grok functionality
body:
# Added Twitter Grok AI Integration

## Motivation
While Grok has a standalone API, it lacks access to Twitter's real-time platform data. This integration taps into Twitter's frontend implementation of Grok, enabling access to Grok's unique capability to analyze and respond to live Twitter data. This provides developers with a powerful tool that combines Grok's language capabilities with Twitter's comprehensive platform data, offering insights and analysis that wouldn't be possible through the standalone Grok API alone.

## Implementation
This PR introduces integration with Twitter's Grok AI chatbot functionality. The implementation includes three main components:

### 1. Grok API Integration (`grok.ts`)
Added a new module that implements Twitter's Grok AI chat functionality, including:
- Support for creating new Grok conversations
- Handling chat interactions with message history
- Managing conversation state and metadata
- Type definitions for Grok's request/response formats
- Support for optional features like search results and citations

### 2. Enhanced Request Handling (`api.ts`)
Modified the `requestApi` function to support:
- Request body parameters for POST requests
- Chunked response handling for streaming responses
- Proper accumulation and parsing of streamed data
- Fallback handling for non-JSON responses
- Improved error handling for streaming scenarios

### 3. Scraper Integration (`scraper.ts`)
Extended the Scraper class with two new public methods:
- `createGrokConversation()`: Initializes a new Grok chat session
- `grokChat()`: Handles message exchange with Grok AI

These changes enable users to interact with Twitter's Grok AI through the same familiar interface used for other Twitter API interactions, while handling all the complexity of managing conversations and streaming responses internally.

title: Added greater agent capabilities, upload media (image/video) + quote tweets (with or without media) + following users, re-tweeting, & liking posts (for the algo !)
body:
# Enhanced Twitter Client Features

This PR adds several new features to the Twitter client to make capabilities more autonomous

## New Features
- Media uploads (photos/videos) support
- Quote tweets functionality
- Following users capability
- Tweet liking functionality

## Technical Details
- Added multi-step video upload process with chunked uploading
- Implemented media processing status checks
- Added rate limit handling for follow operations

## Testing
All new features have been tested, included a command.ts file (optional) which allows user's to test functionalities via a CLI. Added node-fetch as an NPM package to test uploading images/videos from a link.  

## Notes
- Maintains compatibility with existing features
- No breaking changes to the current API
